verses.verse: And it came to pass after<WH310> these things<WH1697>, that one told<WH559> Joseph<WH3130>, Behold, thy father<WH1> is sick<WH2470>: and he took<WH3947> with him his two<WH8147> sons<WH1121>, Manasseh<WH4519> and Ephraim<WH669>.

And one told<WH5046> Jacob<WH3290>, and said<WH559>, Behold, thy son<WH1121> Joseph<WH3130> cometh<WH935> unto thee: and Israel<WH3478> strengthened<WH2388> himself, and sat<WH3427> upon the bed<WH4296>.
And Jacob<WH3290> said<WH559> unto Joseph<WH3130>, God<WH410> Almighty<WH7706> appeared<WH7200> unto me at Luz<WH3870> in the land<WH776> of Canaan<WH3667>, and blessed<WH1288> me,

And said<WH559> unto me, Behold, I will make thee fruitful<WH6509>, and multiply<WH7235> thee, and I will make<WH5414> of thee a multitude<WH6951> of people<WH5971>; and will give<WH5414> this land<WH776> to thy seed<WH2233> after thee<WH310> for an everlasting<WH5769> possession<WH272>.

¶ And now thy two<WH8147> sons<WH1121>, Ephraim<WH669> and Manasseh<WH4519>, which were born<WH3205> unto thee in the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> before<WH5704> I came<WH935> unto thee into Egypt<WH4714>, are mine; as Reuben<WH7205> and Simeon<WH8095>, they shall be mine.

And thy issue<WH4138>, which thou begettest<WH3205> after<WH310> them, shall be thine, and shall be called<WH7121> after<WH5921> the name<WH8034> of their brethren<WH251> in their inheritance<WH5159>.

And as for me, when I came<WH935> from Padan<WH6307>, Rachel<WH7354> died<WH4191> by me in the land<WH776> of Canaan<WH3667> in the way<WH1870>, when<WH5750> yet there was but a little<WH3530> way<WH776> to come<WH935> unto Ephrath<WH672>: and I buried her<WH6912> there in the way<WH1870> of Ephrath<WH672>; the same is Beth-lehem<WH1035>.
And Israel<WH3478> beheld<WH7200> Joseph's<WH3130> sons<WH1121>, and said<WH559>, Who are these?

And Joseph<WH3130> said<WH559> unto his father<WH1>, They are my sons<WH1121>, whom God<WH430> hath given<WH5414> me in this place. And he said<WH559>, Bring them<WH3947>, I pray thee, unto me, and I will bless<WH1288> them.

Now the eyes<WH5869> of Israel<WH3478> were dim<WH3513> for age<WH2207>, so that he could<WH3201> not see<WH7200>. And he brought them near<WH5066> unto him; and he kissed<WH5401> them, and embraced<WH2263> them.
And Israel<WH3478> said<WH559> unto Joseph<WH3130>, I had not thought<WH6419> to see<WH7200> thy face<WH6440>: and, lo, God<WH430> hath shewed<WH7200> me also thy seed<WH2233>.
And Joseph<WH3130> brought them out<WH3318> from between<WH5973> his knees<WH1290>, and he bowed<WH7812> himself with his face<WH639> to the earth<WH776>.

And Joseph<WH3130> took<WH3947> them both<WH8147>, Ephraim<WH669> in his right hand<WH3225> toward Israel's<WH3478> left hand<WH8040>, and Manasseh<WH4519> in his left hand<WH8040> toward Israel's<WH3478> right hand<WH3225>, and brought them near<WH5066> unto him.

And Israel<WH3478> stretched out<WH7971> his right hand<WH3225>, and laid<WH7896> it upon Ephraim's<WH669> head<WH7218>, who was the younger<WH6810>, and his left hand<WH8040> upon Manasseh's<WH4519> head<WH7218>, guiding<WH7919> his hands<WH3027> wittingly<WH7919>; for Manasseh<WH4519> was the firstborn<WH1060>.

¶ And he blessed<WH1288> Joseph<WH3130>, and said<WH559>, God<WH430>, before<WH6440> whom my fathers<WH1> Abraham<WH85> and Isaac<WH3327> did walk<WH1980>, the God<WH430> which fed<WH7462> me all my life long<WH5750> unto this day<WH3117>,

The Angel<WH4397> which redeemed<WH1350> me from all evil<WH7451>, bless<WH1288> the lads<WH5288>; and let my name<WH8034> be named<WH7121> on them, and the name<WH8034> of my fathers<WH1> Abraham<WH85> and Isaac<WH3327>; and let them grow<WH1711> into a multitude<WH7230> in the midst<WH7130> of the earth<WH776>.

And when Joseph<WH3130> saw<WH7200> that his father<WH1> laid<WH7896> his right<WH3225> hand<WH3027> upon the head<WH7218> of Ephraim<WH669>, it displeased<WH3415><WH5869> him: and he held up<WH8551> his father's<WH1> hand<WH3027>, to remove<WH5493> it from Ephraim's<WH669> head<WH7218> unto Manasseh's<WH4519> head<WH7218>.
And Joseph<WH3130> said<WH559> unto his father<WH1>, Not so, my father<WH1>: for this is the firstborn<WH1060>; put<WH7760> thy right hand<WH3225> upon his head<WH7218>.

And his father<WH1> refused<WH3985>, and said<WH559>, I know<WH3045> it, my son<WH1121>, I know<WH3045> it: he also shall become a people<WH5971>, and he also shall be great<WH1431>: but truly<WH199> his younger<WH6996> brother<WH251> shall be greater<WH1431> than he, and his seed<WH2233> shall become a multitude<WH4393> of nations<WH1471>.

And he blessed<WH1288> them that day<WH3117>, saying<WH559>, In thee shall Israel<WH3478> bless<WH1288>, saying<WH559>, God<WH430> make<WH7760> thee as Ephraim<WH669> and as Manasseh<WH4519>: and he set<WH7760> Ephraim<WH669> before<WH6440> Manasseh<WH4519>.
And Israel<WH3478> said<WH559> unto Joseph<WH3130>, Behold, I die<WH4191>: but God<WH430> shall be with you, and bring you again<WH7725> unto the land<WH776> of your fathers<WH1>.

Moreover I have given<WH5414> to thee one<WH259> portion<WH7926> above thy brethren<WH251>, which I took<WH3947> out of the hand<WH3027> of the Amorite<WH567> with my sword<WH2719> and with my bow<WH7198>.
